elements.name: EuMemberState
elements.title: EU Member State / EEA member country

elements.name: UpdateDate
elements.title: The information in this reporting is updated until (date: YYYY-MM-DD format):

elements.name: ReportingUnderArt19
elements.title: Is this reporting the mandatory reporting under Art. 19 and Part 1 of Annex VIII of the Governance Regulation and Annex 1 of the Implementing Act?
elements.tooltip: If no, this reporting is an intermediate update of the information provided so the country profile on Climate-ADAPT (https://climate-adapt.eea.europa.eu/countries-regions/countries) reflects the updated situation. This implicates that an update of the reported information will be provided by the next bi-annual reporting deadline as described in the Governance Regulation

tables.name: National_Circumstances
tables.label: National circumstances
tables.title: National circumstances, impacts, vulnerabilities, risks and adaptive capacity

elements.title: National circumstances relevant to adaptation actions

elements.name: BiogeophysicalCharacteristics
elements.title: Biogeophysical characteristics relevant to adaptation actions (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.1a

elements.name: DemographicSituation
elements.title: Demographic situation relevant to adaptation actions (max. 3000 characers)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.1b

elements.name: EconomicInfrastructuralSituation
elements.title: Economic and infrastructural situation relevant to adaptation actions (max. 8000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.1c

elements.name: AssessmentsIntroDocument
elements.title: If necessary, you can upload here an additional document (max. 2 MB)
elements.tooltip: Accepted file formats are PDF files, MS Word files and JPG figures

elements.name: MainActivitiesClimateMonitoring
elements.title: Main activities on climate monitoring, modelling, projections and scenarios (max. 8 000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.2a

elements.name: ApproachesMethodologiesTools
elements.title: Main approaches, methodologies and tools, and associated uncertainties and challenges (max. 10 000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.2b

elements.name: AssessmentsObservationDocument
elements.title: If necessary, you can upload here an additional document (max. 2 MB)
elements.tooltip: Accepted file formats are PDF files, MS Word files and JPG figures

elements.name: WebLink
elements.title: Web link to the meteorological service

elements.name: Description
elements.title: Description of climate projections and services

elements.name: Status
elements.title: Status of the climate projections and services

elements.name: WebLink
elements.title: Web link to the climate projections and services
Assessment of climate impacts, vulnerability and risks, including adaptive capacity

elements.name: GeneralAspectsAssessment
elements.title: General aspects on the assessment of climate impacts, vulnerability and risks, including adaptive capacity (max. 1000 characters) (optional)
elements.tooltip: Details have to be provided in the following fields

elements.name: CC_IVA
elements.title: Climate change impact and vulnerability assessment (CCIVA) (optional)

elements.name: Title
elements.title: Title of the CCIVA assessment (preferably translated into English)

elements.name: Year
elements.title: Year the CCIVA assessment was completed

elements.name: IsPartNAS
elements.title: CCIVA part of National adaptation strategy (NAS)

elements.name: DescribeExistingEnvironmental
elements.title: Overview of existing pressures (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Member States shall report existing environmental, economic and social pressures that are likely to be significantly affected by climate change: e.g. loss of biodiversity, poor harvest, energy poverty, unemployment, migration. Annex I: 1.3a Footnote3

elements.title: Identification of key future climate hazards

elements.name: DescribeSecondaryEffects
elements.title: (where relevant) Secondary effects of the selected hazards, such as forest fires, spread of invasive species and tropical diseases, cascading effects, and multiple hazards occurring at the same time (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: Footnote5

elements.title: Identify key affected sectors (applying the best available science to assess the different aspects of the vulnerability and risk analysis by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and the latest Commission guidance on the climate proofing of the EU-funded projects)

elements.name: ImpactsKeyHazards
elements.title: Observed impacts of key hazards, including changes in frequency and magnitude
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.3c-i

elements.name: DescribeImpactsKeyHazards
elements.title: Describe your assessment (max. 1500 characters)
elements.tooltip: If 'mixed impact for different hazards' is selected, provide details for the key hazards

elements.name: KeyHazardsLikelihood
elements.title: Likelihood of the occurrence of key hazards and exposure to them under future climate
elements.tooltip: Drawing upon the best available climate modelling science, Annex I: 1.3c-ii

elements.name: DescribeLikelihood
elements.title: Describe your assessment (max. 2000 characters)
elements.tooltip: If 'different likelihood of their occurrence and exposure for different key hazards and/or climate scenarios' is selected, provide details for key hazards, different climate scenarios and geographical differences where relevant

elements.name: Vulnerability
elements.title: Vulnerability, including adaptive capacity
elements.tooltip: Adaptive capacity is defined as 'The ability of systems, institutions, humans and other organisms to adjust to potential damage, to take advantage of opportunities, or to respond to consequences', Annex I: 1.3c-iii

elements.name: DescribeVulnerability
elements.title: Describe your assessment (max. 1500 characters)
elements.tooltip: If 'mixed impact for different hazards' is selected, provide details for the key hazards

elements.name: RiskFutureImpacts
elements.title: Risk of potential future impacts
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 1.3c-iv

elements.name: DescribeRisk
elements.title: Describe your assessment (max. 2000 characters)
elements.tooltip: If 'different rating of risks for different key hazards and/or under different climate scenarios' is selected, provide details for key hazards, different climate scenarios and geographical differences where relevant

tables.name: Legal_Policies
tables.label: Legal and policies
tables.title: Legal and policy frameworks and institutional arrangements

elements.name: LegalPolicyFrameworks
elements.title: Legal and policy frameworks and regulations (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.1

elements.name: Title
elements.title: NAS title
elements.tooltip: preferably translated into English

elements.name: PeriodCovered
elements.title: Period covered by the NAS
elements.tooltip: e.g. 'from 2015-2030' or 'until 2050'

elements.name: Title
elements.title: NAP title
elements.tooltip: preferably translated into English

elements.name: PeriodCovered
elements.title: Period covered by the NAP
elements.tooltip: e.g. 'from 2015-2025' or 'until 2030'

elements.name: Title
elements.title: SAP title
elements.tooltip: preferably translated into English

elements.name: PeriodCovered
elements.title: Period covered by the SAP
elements.tooltip: e.g. 'from 2015-2025' or 'until 2030'

elements.title: Overview of institutional arrangements and governance at the national level

elements.name: ArrangementsCCIV_assessments
elements.title: Climate vulnerability and risk assessment (max. 1000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.2a

elements.name: DescribeInstitutionalArrangements
elements.title: Planning, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and revision of adaptation policy (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Aspects to consider include decision making, planning and coordination related to adaptation strategies, policies, plans and goals, addressing cross-cutting issues, adjusting adaptation priorities and activities, implementing adaptation actions, including facilitating action to avert, minimise and address the adverse effect of climate change. Annex I: 2.2b

elements.name: DescribeEIA
elements.title: Integration of climate change impacts and resilience into environmental assessment procedures (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.2c

elements.name: DescribeCollection
elements.title: Collection, ownership and re-use of relevant data and access to it (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Relevant data: such as climate-related disaster loss data or risk data. Annex I: 2.2d

elements.name: DescribeDRR
elements.title: Integration of climate change impacts and adaptation planning into disaster risk management frameworks and vice versa (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Including Article 6(1) of Decision No 1313/2013/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 on a Union Civil Protection Mechanism (OJ L 347 I, 20.12.2013, p. 924)(https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32013D1313). Annex I: 2.2e

elements.title: Overview of institutional arrangements and governance at the sub-national level (where “sub-national” refers to local and regional)

elements.name: SummarizeLegalRequirements
elements.title: Legal requirements and strategic documents (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.3a

elements.name: SummarizeNetworks
elements.title: Networks or other collaborations on adaptation across national authorities (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.3b

elements.name: SummarizeGoodPractice
elements.title: Good practice examples of networks or other collaborations on adaptation across local and regional authorities (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 2.3c

tables.name: Strategies_Plans
tables.label: Strategies and plans
tables.title: Adaptation strategies, policies, plans and goals

elements.name: AdaptationPriorities
elements.title: Adaptation priorities (max. 750 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 3.1

elements.name: Challenges
elements.title: Challenges, gaps and barriers to adaptation (max. 2000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Including those institutional, governance-related and other barriers that restrict the adaptive capacity as identified in the vulnerability assessment. Annex I: 3.2

elements.name: SummaryNationalStrategies
elements.title: Summaries of national strategies, policies, plans and efforts, with a focus on goals and objectives, foreseen actions, budget and timeline (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Including nature-based solutions and actions leading to mitigation co-benefits and other relevant co-benefits. The summaries shall cover also efforts to build resilience and avert, minimise and address the adverse consequences of climate change, and include an explanation how gender perspectives have been taken into account. Annex I: 3.3

elements.name: ActionsMeasures
elements.title: Selection of actions and (programmes of) measures (optional)

elements.name: Title
elements.title: Title of the measure or action
elements.tooltip: Preferably translated into English, see Dataflow Help for additional explanation

elements.name: KeyTypeMeasure
elements.title: Key Type Measure (KTM)
elements.tooltip: See Dataflow Help for definitions and examples

elements.name: ShortDescriptionMeasureAction
elements.title: Short description of the measure or action (max. 500 characters)

elements.name: AdministrativeLevelMeasureImplemented
elements.title: Administrative level the measure is implemented

elements.name: CostImplementingMeasure
elements.title: The cost of implementing the measure (max. 300 characters)

elements.name: Examples
elements.title: Weblink
elements.tooltip: Provide an url for more information about the action/measure, additional information not available online can be attached in the file under this table

elements.name: AditionalDocument
elements.title: If necessary, you can upload here an additional document on the actions and (programmes of) measures reported in the optional table above (max. 2 MB)
elements.tooltip: Accepted file formats are PDF files, MS Word files and JPG figures

elements.name: OverviewContent
elements.title: Overview of the content of sub-national strategies, policies, plans and efforts (max. 10 000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 3.4

elements.name: OverviewEffortsClimate
elements.title: Overview of efforts to integrate climate change adaptation into sectoral policies, plans and programs, including disaster risk management strategies and action plans (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 3.5

elements.name: OverviewMeasures
elements.title: Overview of measures in adaptation policy at the national level and good practice examples from the sub-national levels to engage with stakeholders particularly vulnerable to climate change impacts (max 10 000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 3.6a

elements.name: OverviewPrivateSector
elements.title: Overview of measures in adaptation policy at the national level and good practice examples from the sub-national levels to engage with the private sector (max 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Member States shall provide an overview of available information on private sector plans, priorities, actions and programmes, public/private partnerships, and other relevant private adaptation initiatives and/or projects. Annex I: 3.6b

tables.name: Monitoring_Evaluation
tables.label: Monitoring and evaluation
tables.title: Monitoring, reporting and evaluation of adaptation actions and processes

elements.name: DescribeMonitoringReportingEvaluation
elements.title: Monitoring, reporting and evaluation (MRE) methodology related to reducing climate impacts, vulnerabilities, risks, and increasing adaptive capacity (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Member States shall report on approaches, systems used, transparency and indicators. Annex I: 4.1a

elements.name: DescribeMREMethodology
elements.title: MRE methodology related to the implementation of adaptation actions (max. 2000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Member States shall report on approaches, systems used, transparency and indicators. Annex I: 4.1b

elements.name: MonitoringIndicatorsMethodologies
elements.title: Sources for monitoring, reporting and evaluation (MRE) indicators and methodologies (optional)

elements.name: Description
elements.title: Name or short description for the MRE indicators or methodologies

elements.name: IndicatorsMethodology
elements.title: Status of the MRE indicators and/or methodology

elements.name: Link
elements.title: Link to the MRE indicators and/or methodologies

elements.name: DescribeStatePlay
elements.title: State of play of the implementation of measures planned under 'Strategies and Plans', including an overview of the subnational level and the disbursement of funding to increase climate resilience (max. 5000 characters)
elements.tooltip: This field refers to the information provided in the webform 'Strategies and plans', including the detailed information in the optional table 'Selection of actions and (programmes of) measures'. Annex I: 4.2

elements.name: SummaryClimateAdaptation
elements.title: State of play of the implementation of measures planned under 'Strategies and Plans': spending earmarked for climate adaptation including in disaster risk management (max. 1500 characters)
elements.tooltip: This field refers to the information provided in the webform 'Strategies and plans', including the detailed information in the optional table 'Selection of actions and (programmes of) measures'. Annex I: 4.2a

elements.name: SummarySpendingShare
elements.title: To the extent possible, state of play of the implementation of measures planned under 'Strategies and Plans': the share of spending used to support climate adaptation in each sector (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Share of spending used to support climate adaptation as the additional investment that makes a project (that would have been realised anyway) climate resilient. For an overview of sectors see 'Affected sectors' in the 'National Circumstances' webform, or in the optional table 'Selection of actions and (programmes of) measures'. Annex I: 4.2b

elements.name: DescribeReducingClimateImpacts
elements.title: Progress towards reducing climate impacts, vulnerabilities and risks (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Based on the MRE methodology reported above. Annex I: 4.3a

elements.name: DescribeIncreasingAdaptiveCapacity
elements.title: Progress towards increasing adaptive capacity (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Based on the MRE methodology reported above. Annex I: 4.3b

elements.name: DescribeMeetingAdaptationPriorities
elements.title: Progress towards meeting adaptation priorities (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Based on the MRE methodology reported above. Annex I: 4.3c

elements.name: DescribeProgressTowardsAddressing
elements.title: Progress towards addressing barriers to adaptation (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Based on the MRE methodology reported above. Annex I: 4.3d

elements.name: DescribeVulnerability
elements.title: Steps taken to review and update vulnerability and risk assessments (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 4.4a

elements.name: DescribeNationalAdaptation
elements.title: Steps taken to review and update national adaptation policies, strategies, plans, and measures (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 4.4b

elements.name: DescribeSubnationalAdaptation
elements.title: Overview of good practice with regard to steps taken to review and update subnational adaptation plans, policies, strategies and measures (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 4.5

tables.name: Cooperation_Experience
tables.label: Cooperation and experience
tables.title: Cooperation, good practices, synergies, experience and lessons learned in the field of adaptation

elements.name: Area
elements.title: Area of good practices
elements.tooltip: Select minimum 1 of the following areas of good practice (any combination of areas is possible). Annex I: footnote 19

elements.name: DescribeGoodPractice
elements.title: Good practices and lessons learnt, including at sub-national level (max. 500 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 5.1

elements.name: DescribeSynergiesAdaptation
elements.title: Synergies of adaptation actions with other international frameworks and/or conventions (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: In particular the Sustainable Development Goals and the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction, Annex I: 5.2

elements.name: DescribeDetailShareInformation
elements.title: Cooperation with Union Member States, international cooperation, and with regional and international organisations to share information and to strengthen science, institutions and adaptation knowledge (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Excluding information on support to developing countries referred to in Part 2 of Annex VIII of Regulation (EU) 2018/1999. Annex I: 5.3a

elements.name: DescribeDetailCooperationEnhance
elements.title: Cooperation with Union Member States, international cooperation, and with regional and international organisations to enhance adaptation action at the sub-national, national, macro-regional and international level (max. 3000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Including the area, scale and types of cooperation. Excluding information on support to developing countries referred to in Part 2 of Annex VIII of Regulation (EU) 2018/1999. Annex I: 5.3b

tables.name: Contact
tables.label: Contact
tables.title: Any other information related to climate change impacts and adaptation

elements.name: ContactGeneral
elements.title: Key contact details of national coordinator and organisation

elements.name: Organisation
elements.title: Organisation
elements.tooltip: Maximum 5 records can be added to this table, provide details of coordinating organisations. Annex I: 6.1

elements.name: Role
elements.title: Role of the organisation
elements.tooltip: e.g. Coordinating adaptation policies or responsible for reporting

elements.name: RoleContact
elements.title: Role of the contact person
elements.tooltip: e.g. National Focal Point

elements.name: GeneralEmail
elements.title: Email address
elements.tooltip: Important! Keep in mind that this information will be made available in the country profiles of Climate-ADAPT. We suggest to fill in a functional mailbox used for questions on adaptation rather than a personal email address from the contact person.

elements.name: Website
elements.title: Website
elements.tooltip: Preferably a link to the section on adaptation on the website of the organisation or otherwise the general website of the organisation.

elements.name: Websites
elements.title: Relevant websites and social media sources (as appropriate)

elements.name: Title
elements.title: Title
elements.tooltip: Title of relevant website or social media source used for communication on adaptation action at national and sub-national level (preferably translated into English), Annex I: 6.2

elements.name: Name
elements.title: Name
elements.tooltip: Name of the climate, hazards, vulnerability, impact or adaptation portal or platform (preferably translated into English)

elements.name: Focus
elements.title: Focus of the portal or platform

elements.name: Publications
elements.title: Key reports and publications at national and sub-national level

elements.name: TitleEnglish
elements.title: Title
elements.tooltip: Do not repeat links to documents already provided elsewhere (like links to NAS or NAP). Links to documents in assessment texts not provided yet can be added here. Preferably translate titles into English. Annex I: 6.3

elements.name: Publisher
elements.title: Publisher
elements.tooltip: The organisation that published the report or document, preferably translated into English

elements.name: AdditionalInformation
elements.title: Any other relevant information (max. 1000 characters)
elements.tooltip: Annex I: 6.4

elements.name: AdditionalDocument
elements.title: If necessary, you can upload here an additional document (max. 2 MB)
